92/* Hackery at it's finest. */
93#ifndef s6_addr32
94# ifdef __sun
95# define s6_addr32 _S6_un._S6_u32
96# else
97# define s6_addr32 __u6_addr.__u6_addr32
98# endif
99#endif
100
101#if defined(HAVE_IN6_ADDR_GEN_MODE_NONE) || defined(ND6_IFF_AUTO_LINKLOCAL) || \
102 defined(IFF_NOLINKLOCAL)
103/* Only add the LL address if we have a carrier, so DaD works. */
104#define CAN_ADD_LLADDR(ifp) \
105 (!((ifp)->options->options & DHCPCD_LINK) || (ifp)->carrier != LINK_DOWN)
106#ifdef __sun
107/* Although we can add our own LL address, we cannot drop it
108 * without unplumbing the if which is a lot of code.
109 * So just keep it for the time being. */
110#define CAN_DROP_LLADDR(ifp) (0)
111#else
112#define CAN_DROP_LLADDR(ifp) (1)
113#endif
114#else
115/* We have no control over the OS adding the LLADDR, so just let it do it
116 * as we cannot force our own view on it. */
117#define CAN_ADD_LLADDR(ifp) (0)
118#define CAN_DROP_LLADDR(ifp) (0)
119#endif

121#ifdef IPV6_MANAGETEMPADDR
122static void ipv6_regentempifid(void *);
123static void ipv6_regentempaddr(void *);
124#else
125#define ipv6_regentempifid(a) {}
126#endif
127
128int
129ipv6_init(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
130{
131
132 if (ctx->ra_routers != NULL)
133 return 0;
134
135 ctx->ra_routers = malloc(sizeof(*ctx->ra_routers));
136 if (ctx->ra_routers == NULL)
137 return -1;
138 TAILQ_INIT(ctx->ra_routers);
139
140#ifndef __sun
141 ctx->nd_fd = -1;
142#endif
143 ctx->dhcp6_fd = -1;
144 return 0;
145}
146
147static ssize_t
148ipv6_readsecret(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
149{
150 FILE *fp;
151 char line[1024];
152 unsigned char *p;
153 size_t len;
154 uint32_t r;
155 int x;
156
157 if ((ctx->secret_len = read_hwaddr_aton(&ctx->secret, SECRET)) != 0)
158 return (ssize_t)ctx->secret_len;
159
160 if (errno != ENOENT)
161 logerr("%s: %s", __func__, SECRET);
162
163 /* Chaining arc4random should be good enough.
164 * RFC7217 section 5.1 states the key SHOULD be at least 128 bits.
165 * To attempt and future proof ourselves, we'll generate a key of
166 * 512 bits (64 bytes). */
167 if (ctx->secret_len < 64) {
168 if ((ctx->secret = malloc(64)) == NULL) {
169 logerr(__func__);
170 return -1;
171 }
172 ctx->secret_len = 64;
173 }
174 p = ctx->secret;
175 for (len = 0; len < 512 / NBBY; len += sizeof(r)) {
176 r = arc4random();
177 memcpy(p, &r, sizeof(r));
178 p += sizeof(r);
179 }
180
181 /* Ensure that only the dhcpcd user can read the secret.
182 * Write permission is also denied as chaning it would remove
183 * it's stability. */
184 if ((fp = fopen(SECRET, "w")) == NULL ||
185 chmod(SECRET, S_IRUSR) == -1)
186 goto eexit;
187 x = fprintf(fp, "%s\n",
188 hwaddr_ntoa(ctx->secret, ctx->secret_len, line, sizeof(line)));
189 if (fclose(fp) == EOF)
190 x = -1;
191 fp = NULL;
192 if (x > 0)
193 return (ssize_t)ctx->secret_len;
194
195eexit:
196 logerr("%s: %s", __func__, SECRET);
197 if (fp != NULL)
198 fclose(fp);
199 unlink(SECRET);
200 ctx->secret_len = 0;
201 return -1;
202}
203
204/* http://www.iana.org/assignments/ipv6-interface-ids/ipv6-interface-ids.xhtml
205 * RFC5453 */
206static const struct reslowhigh {
207 const uint8_t high[8];
208 const uint8_t low[8];
209} reslowhigh[] = {
210 /* RFC4291 + RFC6543 */
211 { { 0x02, 0x00, 0x5e, 0xff, 0xfe, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 },
212 { 0x02, 0x00, 0x5e, 0xff, 0xfe, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff } },
213 /* RFC2526 */
214 { { 0xfd, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x80 },
215 { 0xfd, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff } }
216};
217
218static int
219ipv6_reserved(const struct in6_addr *addr)
220{
221 uint64_t id, low, high;
222 size_t i;
223 const struct reslowhigh *r;
224
225 id = be64dec(addr->s6_addr + sizeof(id));
226 if (id == 0) /* RFC4291 */
227 return 1;
228 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(reslowhigh) / sizeof(reslowhigh[0]); i++) {
229 r = &reslowhigh[i];
230 low = be64dec(r->low);
231 high = be64dec(r->high);
232 if (id >= low && id <= high)
233 return 1;
234 }
235 return 0;
236}
237
238/* RFC7217 */
239static int
240ipv6_makestableprivate1(struct in6_addr *addr,
241 const struct in6_addr *prefix, int prefix_len,
242 const unsigned char *netiface, size_t netiface_len,
243 const unsigned char *netid, size_t netid_len,
244 unsigned short vlanid,
245 uint32_t *dad_counter,
246 const unsigned char *secret, size_t secret_len)
247{
248 unsigned char buf[2048], *p, digest[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH];
249 size_t len, l;
250 SHA256_CTX ctx;
251
252 if (prefix_len < 0 || prefix_len > 120) {
253 errno = EINVAL;
254 return -1;
255 }
256
257 l = (size_t)(ROUNDUP8(prefix_len) / NBBY);
258 len = l + netiface_len + netid_len + sizeof(*dad_counter) + secret_len;
259 if (vlanid != 0)
260 len += sizeof(vlanid);
261 if (len > sizeof(buf)) {
262 errno = ENOBUFS;
263 return -1;
264 }
265
266 for (;; (*dad_counter)++) {
267 /* Combine all parameters into one buffer */
268 p = buf;
269 memcpy(p, prefix, l);
270 p += l;
271 memcpy(p, netiface, netiface_len);
272 p += netiface_len;
273 memcpy(p, netid, netid_len);
274 p += netid_len;
275 /* Don't use a vlanid if not set.
276 * This ensures prior versions have the same unique address. */
277 if (vlanid != 0) {
278 memcpy(p, &vlanid, sizeof(vlanid));
279 p += sizeof(vlanid);
280 }
281 memcpy(p, dad_counter, sizeof(*dad_counter));
282 p += sizeof(*dad_counter);
283 memcpy(p, secret, secret_len);
284
285 /* Make an address using the digest of the above.
286 * RFC7217 Section 5.1 states that we shouldn't use MD5.
287 * Pity as we use that for HMAC-MD5 which is still deemed OK.
288 * SHA-256 is recommended */
289 SHA256_Init(&ctx);
290 SHA256_Update(&ctx, buf, len);
291 SHA256_Final(digest, &ctx);
292
293 p = addr->s6_addr;
294 memcpy(p, prefix, l);
295 /* RFC7217 section 5.2 says we need to start taking the id from
296 * the least significant bit */
297 len = sizeof(addr->s6_addr) - l;
298 memcpy(p + l, digest + (sizeof(digest) - len), len);
299
300 /* Ensure that the Interface ID does not match a reserved one,
301 * if it does then treat it as a DAD failure.
302 * RFC7217 section 5.2 */
303 if (prefix_len != 64)
304 break;
305 if (!ipv6_reserved(addr))
306 break;
307 }
308
309 return 0;
310}
311
312int
313ipv6_makestableprivate(struct in6_addr *addr,
314 const struct in6_addr *prefix, int prefix_len,
315 const struct interface *ifp,
316 int *dad_counter)
317{
318 uint32_t dad;
319 int r;
320
321 if (ifp->ctx->secret_len == 0) {
322 if (ipv6_readsecret(ifp->ctx) == -1)
323 return -1;
324 }
325
326 dad = (uint32_t)*dad_counter;
327
328 /* For our implementation, we shall set the hardware address
329 * as the interface identifier */
330 r = ipv6_makestableprivate1(addr, prefix, prefix_len,
331 ifp->hwaddr, ifp->hwlen,
332 ifp->ssid, ifp->ssid_len,
333 ifp->vlanid, &dad,
334 ifp->ctx->secret, ifp->ctx->secret_len);
335
336 if (r == 0)
337 *dad_counter = (int)dad;
338 return r;
339}
340
341int
342ipv6_makeaddr(struct in6_addr *addr, struct interface *ifp,
343 const struct in6_addr *prefix, int prefix_len)
344{
345 const struct ipv6_addr *ap;
346 int dad;
347
348 if (prefix_len < 0 || prefix_len > 120) {
349 errno = EINVAL;
350 return -1;
351 }
352
353 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_SLAACPRIVATE) {
354 dad = 0;
355 if (ipv6_makestableprivate(addr,
356 prefix, prefix_len, ifp, &dad) == -1)
357 return -1;
358 return dad;
359 }
360
361 if (prefix_len > 64) {
362 errno = EINVAL;
363 return -1;
364 }
365 if ((ap = ipv6_linklocal(ifp)) == NULL) {
366 /* We delay a few functions until we get a local-link address
367 * so this should never be hit. */
368 errno = ENOENT;
369 return -1;
370 }
371
372 /* Make the address from the first local-link address */
373 memcpy(addr, prefix, sizeof(*prefix));
374 addr->s6_addr32[2] = ap->addr.s6_addr32[2];
375 addr->s6_addr32[3] = ap->addr.s6_addr32[3];
376 return 0;
377}
378
379static int
380ipv6_makeprefix(struct in6_addr *prefix, const struct in6_addr *addr, int len)
381{
382 int bytes, bits;
383
384 if (len < 0 || len > 128) {
385 errno = EINVAL;
386 return -1;
387 }
388
389 bytes = len / NBBY;
390 bits = len % NBBY;
391 memcpy(&prefix->s6_addr, &addr->s6_addr, (size_t)bytes);
392 if (bits != 0) {
393 /* Coverify false positive.
394 * bytelen cannot be 16 if bitlen is non zero */
395 /* coverity[overrun-local] */
396 prefix->s6_addr[bytes] =
397 (uint8_t)(prefix->s6_addr[bytes] >> (NBBY - bits));
398 }
399 memset((char *)prefix->s6_addr + bytes, 0,
400 sizeof(prefix->s6_addr) - (size_t)bytes);
401 return 0;
402}
403
404int
405ipv6_mask(struct in6_addr *mask, int len)
406{
407 static const unsigned char masks[NBBY] =
408 { 0x80, 0xc0, 0xe0, 0xf0, 0xf8, 0xfc, 0xfe, 0xff };
409 int bytes, bits, i;
410
411 if (len < 0 || len > 128) {
412 errno = EINVAL;
413 return -1;
414 }
415
416 memset(mask, 0, sizeof(*mask));
417 bytes = len / NBBY;
418 bits = len % NBBY;
419 for (i = 0; i < bytes; i++)
420 mask->s6_addr[i] = 0xff;
421 if (bits != 0) {
422 /* Coverify false positive.
423 * bytelen cannot be 16 if bitlen is non zero */
424 /* coverity[overrun-local] */
425 mask->s6_addr[bytes] = masks[bits - 1];
426 }
427 return 0;
428}
429
430uint8_t
431ipv6_prefixlen(const struct in6_addr *mask)
432{
433 int x = 0, y;
434 const unsigned char *lim, *p;
435
436 lim = (const unsigned char *)mask + sizeof(*mask);
437 for (p = (const unsigned char *)mask; p < lim; x++, p++) {
438 if (*p != 0xff)
439 break;
440 }
441 y = 0;
442 if (p < lim) {
443 for (y = 0; y < NBBY; y++) {
444 if ((*p & (0x80 >> y)) == 0)
445 break;
446 }
447 }
448
449 /*
450 * when the limit pointer is given, do a stricter check on the
451 * remaining bits.
452 */
453 if (p < lim) {
454 if (y != 0 && (*p & (0x00ff >> y)) != 0)
455 return 0;
456 for (p = p + 1; p < lim; p++)
457 if (*p != 0)
458 return 0;
459 }
460
461 return (uint8_t)(x * NBBY + y);
462}
463
464static void
465in6_to_h64(uint64_t *vhigh, uint64_t *vlow, const struct in6_addr *addr)
466{
467
468 *vhigh = be64dec(addr->s6_addr);
469 *vlow = be64dec(addr->s6_addr + 8);
470}
471
472static void
473h64_to_in6(struct in6_addr *addr, uint64_t vhigh, uint64_t vlow)
474{
475
476 be64enc(addr->s6_addr, vhigh);
477 be64enc(addr->s6_addr + 8, vlow);
478}
479
480int
481ipv6_userprefix(
482 const struct in6_addr *prefix, // prefix from router
483 short prefix_len, // length of prefix received
484 uint64_t user_number, // "random" number from user
485 struct in6_addr *result, // resultant prefix
486 short result_len) // desired prefix length
487{
488 uint64_t vh, vl, user_low, user_high;
489
490 if (prefix_len < 1 || prefix_len > 128 ||
491 result_len < 1 || result_len > 128)
492 {
493 errno = EINVAL;
494 return -1;
495 }
496
497 /* Check that the user_number fits inside result_len less prefix_len */
498 if (result_len < prefix_len ||
499 fls64(user_number) > result_len - prefix_len)
500 {
501 errno = ERANGE;
502 return -1;
503 }
504
505 /* If user_number is zero, just copy the prefix into the result. */
506 if (user_number == 0) {
507 *result = *prefix;
508 return 0;
509 }
510
511 /* Shift user_number so it fit's just inside result_len.
512 * Shifting by 0 or sizeof(user_number) is undefined,
513 * so we cater for that. */
514 if (result_len == 128) {
515 user_high = 0;
516 user_low = user_number;
517 } else if (result_len > 64) {
518 if (prefix_len >= 64)
519 user_high = 0;
520 else
521 user_high = user_number >> (result_len - prefix_len);
522 user_low = user_number << (128 - result_len);
523 } else if (result_len == 64) {
524 user_high = user_number;
525 user_low = 0;
526 } else {
527 user_high = user_number << (64 - result_len);
528 user_low = 0;
529 }
530
531 /* convert to two 64bit host order values */
532 in6_to_h64(&vh, &vl, prefix);
533
534 vh |= user_high;
535 vl |= user_low;
536
537 /* copy back result */
538 h64_to_in6(result, vh, vl);
539
540 return 0;
541}
542
543#ifdef IPV6_POLLADDRFLAG
544void
545ipv6_checkaddrflags(void *arg)
546{
547 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
548 int flags;
549 const char *alias;
550
551 ia = arg;
552#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
553 alias = ia->alias;
554#else
555 alias = NULL;
556#endif
557 if ((flags = if_addrflags6(ia->iface, &ia->addr, alias)) == -1) {
558 if (errno != EEXIST && errno != EADDRNOTAVAIL)
559 logerr("%s: if_addrflags6", __func__);
560 return;
561 }
562
563 if (!(flags & IN6_IFF_TENTATIVE)) {
564 /* Simulate the kernel announcing the new address. */
565 ipv6_handleifa(ia->iface->ctx, RTM_NEWADDR,
566 ia->iface->ctx->ifaces, ia->iface->name,
567 &ia->addr, ia->prefix_len, flags, 0);
568 } else {
569 /* Still tentative? Check again in a bit. */
570 struct timespec tv;
571
572 ms_to_ts(&tv, RETRANS_TIMER / 2);
573 eloop_timeout_add_tv(ia->iface->ctx->eloop, &tv,
574 ipv6_checkaddrflags, ia);
575 }
576}
577#endif
578
579static void
580ipv6_deletedaddr(struct ipv6_addr *ia)
581{
582
583#ifdef SMALL
584 UNUSED(ia);
585#else
586 /* NOREJECT is set if we delegated exactly the prefix to another
587 * address.
588 * This can only be one address, so just clear the flag.
589 * This should ensure the reject route will be restored. */
590 if (ia->delegating_prefix != NULL)
591 ia->delegating_prefix->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_NOREJECT;
592#endif
593}
594
595void
596ipv6_deleteaddr(struct ipv6_addr *ia)
597{
598 struct ipv6_state *state;
599 struct ipv6_addr *ap;
600
601 loginfox("%s: deleting address %s", ia->iface->name, ia->saddr);
602 if (if_address6(RTM_DELADDR, ia) == -1 &&
603 errno != EADDRNOTAVAIL && errno != ESRCH &&
604 errno != ENXIO && errno != ENODEV)
605 logerr(__func__);
606
607 ipv6_deletedaddr(ia);
608
609 state = IPV6_STATE(ia->iface);
610 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &state->addrs, next) {
611 if (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ap->addr, &ia->addr)) {
612 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, ap, next);
613 ipv6_freeaddr(ap);
614 break;
615 }
616 }
617
618 /* Advertise the address if it exists on another interface. */
619 ipv6nd_advertise(ia);
620}
621
622static int
623ipv6_addaddr1(struct ipv6_addr *ia, const struct timespec *now)
624{
625 struct interface *ifp;
626 uint32_t pltime, vltime;
627 bool vltime_was_zero;
628 __printflike(1, 2) void (*logfunc)(const char *, ...);
629#ifdef __sun
630 struct ipv6_state *state;
631 struct ipv6_addr *ia2;
632#endif
633
634 /* Remember the interface of the address. */
635 ifp = ia->iface;
636
637 if (!(ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED) &&
638 ipv6_iffindaddr(ifp, &ia->addr, IN6_IFF_NOTUSEABLE))
639 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED;
640
641 /* Adjust plftime and vltime based on acquired time */
642 pltime = ia->prefix_pltime;
643 vltime = ia->prefix_vltime;
644 if (timespecisset(&ia->acquired) &&
645 (ia->prefix_pltime != ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME ||
646 ia->prefix_vltime != ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME))
647 {
648 struct timespec n;
649
650 if (now == NULL) {
651 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &n);
652 now = &n;
653 }
654 timespecsub(now, &ia->acquired, &n);
655 if (ia->prefix_pltime != ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME) {
656 ia->prefix_pltime -= (uint32_t)n.tv_sec;
657 /* This can happen when confirming a
658 * deprecated but still valid lease. */
659 if (ia->prefix_pltime > pltime)
660 ia->prefix_pltime = 0;
661 }
662 if (ia->prefix_vltime != ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME) {
663 ia->prefix_vltime -= (uint32_t)n.tv_sec;
664 /* This should never happen. */
665 if (ia->prefix_vltime > vltime) {
666 logerrx("%s: %s: lifetime overflow",
667 ifp->name, ia->saddr);
668 ia->prefix_vltime = ia->prefix_pltime = 0;
669 }
670 }
671 }
672
673 logfunc = ia->flags & IPV6_AF_NEW ? loginfox : logdebugx;
674 logfunc("%s: adding %saddress %s", ifp->name,
675#ifdef IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY
676 ia->flags & IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY ? "temporary " : "",
677#else
678 "",
679#endif
680 ia->saddr);
681 if (ia->prefix_pltime == ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME &&
682 ia->prefix_vltime == ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME)
683 logdebugx("%s: pltime infinity, vltime infinity",
684 ifp->name);
685 else if (ia->prefix_pltime == ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME)
686 logdebugx("%s: pltime infinity, vltime %"PRIu32" seconds",
687 ifp->name, ia->prefix_vltime);
688 else if (ia->prefix_vltime == ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME)
689 logdebugx("%s: pltime %"PRIu32"seconds, vltime infinity",
690 ifp->name, ia->prefix_pltime);
691 else
692 logdebugx("%s: pltime %"PRIu32" seconds, vltime %"PRIu32
693 " seconds",
694 ifp->name, ia->prefix_pltime, ia->prefix_vltime);
695
696 vltime_was_zero = ia->prefix_vltime == 0;
697 if (if_address6(RTM_NEWADDR, ia) == -1) {
698 logerr(__func__);
699 /* Restore real pltime and vltime */
700 ia->prefix_pltime = pltime;
701 ia->prefix_vltime = vltime;
702 return -1;
703 }
704
705#ifdef IPV6_MANAGETEMPADDR
706 /* RFC4941 Section 3.4 */
707 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY &&
708 ia->prefix_pltime &&
709 ia->prefix_vltime &&
710 ip6_use_tempaddr(ifp->name))
711 eloop_timeout_add_sec(ifp->ctx->eloop,
712 (time_t)ia->prefix_pltime - REGEN_ADVANCE,
713 ipv6_regentempaddr, ia);
714#endif
715
716 /* Restore real pltime and vltime */
717 ia->prefix_pltime = pltime;
718 ia->prefix_vltime = vltime;
719
720 ia->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_NEW;
721 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_ADDED;
722#ifndef SMALL
723 if (ia->delegating_prefix != NULL)
724 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_DELEGATED;
725#endif
726
727#ifdef IPV6_POLLADDRFLAG
728 eloop_timeout_delete(ifp->ctx->eloop,
729 ipv6_checkaddrflags, ia);
730 if (!(ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED)) {
731 struct timespec tv;
732
733 ms_to_ts(&tv, RETRANS_TIMER / 2);
734 eloop_timeout_add_tv(ifp->ctx->eloop,
735 &tv, ipv6_checkaddrflags, ia);
736 }
737#endif
738
739#ifdef __sun
740 /* Solaris does not announce new addresses which need DaD
741 * so we need to take a copy and add it to our list.
742 * Otherwise aliasing gets confused if we add another
743 * address during DaD. */
744
745 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
746 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia2, &state->addrs, next) {
747 if (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ia2->addr, &ia->addr))
748 break;
749 }
750 if (ia2 == NULL) {
751 if ((ia2 = malloc(sizeof(*ia2))) == NULL) {
752 logerr(__func__);
753 return 0; /* Well, we did add the address */
754 }
755 memcpy(ia2, ia, sizeof(*ia2));
756 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ia2, next);
757 }
758#endif
759
760 /* Re-advertise the preferred address to be safe. */
761 if (!vltime_was_zero)
762 ipv6nd_advertise(ia);
763
764 return 0;
765}
766
767#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
768/* Find the next logical alias address we can use. */
769static int
770ipv6_aliasaddr(struct ipv6_addr *ia, struct ipv6_addr **repl)
771{
772 struct ipv6_state *state;
773 struct ipv6_addr *iap;
774 unsigned int lun;
775 char alias[IF_NAMESIZE];
776
777 if (ia->alias[0] != '\0')
778 return 0;
779 state = IPV6_STATE(ia->iface);
780
781 /* First find an existng address.
782 * This can happen when dhcpcd restarts as ND and DHCPv6
783 * maintain their own lists of addresses. */
784 TAILQ_FOREACH(iap, &state->addrs, next) {
785 if (iap->alias[0] != '\0' &&
786 IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&iap->addr, &ia->addr))
787 {
788 strlcpy(ia->alias, iap->alias, sizeof(ia->alias));
789 return 0;
790 }
791 }
792
793 lun = 0;
794find_unit:
795 if (if_makealias(alias, IF_NAMESIZE, ia->iface->name, lun) >=
796 IF_NAMESIZE)
797 {
798 errno = ENOMEM;
799 return -1;
800 }
801 TAILQ_FOREACH(iap, &state->addrs, next) {
802 if (iap->alias[0] == '\0')
803 continue;
804 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&iap->addr)) {
805 /* No address assigned? Lets use it. */
806 strlcpy(ia->alias, iap->alias, sizeof(ia->alias));
807 if (repl)
808 *repl = iap;
809 return 1;
810 }
811 if (strcmp(iap->alias, alias) == 0)
812 break;
813 }
814
815 if (iap != NULL) {
816 if (lun == UINT_MAX) {
817 errno = ERANGE;
818 return -1;
819 }
820 lun++;
821 goto find_unit;
822 }
823
824 strlcpy(ia->alias, alias, sizeof(ia->alias));
825 return 0;
826}
827#endif
828
829int
830ipv6_addaddr(struct ipv6_addr *ia, const struct timespec *now)
831{
832 int r;
833#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
834 int replaced, blank;
835 struct ipv6_addr *replaced_ia;
836
837 blank = (ia->alias[0] == '\0');
838 if ((replaced = ipv6_aliasaddr(ia, &replaced_ia)) == -1)
839 return -1;
840 if (blank)
841 logdebugx("%s: aliased %s", ia->alias, ia->saddr);
842#endif
843
844 if ((r = ipv6_addaddr1(ia, now)) == 0) {
845#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
846 if (replaced) {
847 struct ipv6_state *state;
848
849 state = IPV6_STATE(ia->iface);
850 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, replaced_ia, next);
851 ipv6_freeaddr(replaced_ia);
852 }
853#endif
854 }
855 return r;
856}
857
858int
859ipv6_findaddrmatch(const struct ipv6_addr *addr, const struct in6_addr *match,
860 unsigned int flags)
861{
862
863 if (match == NULL) {
864 if ((addr->flags &
865 (IPV6_AF_ADDED | IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED)) ==
866 (IPV6_AF_ADDED | IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED))
867 return 1;
868 } else if (addr->prefix_vltime &&
869 IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&addr->addr, match) &&
870 (!flags || addr->flags & flags))
871 return 1;
872
873 return 0;
874}
875
876struct ipv6_addr *
877ipv6_findaddr(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, const struct in6_addr *addr, unsigned int flags)
878{
879 struct ipv6_addr *nap;
880#ifdef DHCP6
881 struct ipv6_addr *dap;
882#endif
883
884 nap = ipv6nd_findaddr(ctx, addr, flags);
885#ifdef DHCP6
886 dap = dhcp6_findaddr(ctx, addr, flags);
887 if (!dap && !nap)
888 return NULL;
889 if (dap && !nap)
890 return dap;
891 if (nap && !dap)
892 return nap;
893 if (nap->iface->metric < dap->iface->metric)
894 return nap;
895 return dap;
896#else
897 return nap;
898#endif
899}
900
901ssize_t
902ipv6_addaddrs(struct ipv6_addrhead *addrs)
903{
904 struct ipv6_addr *ap, *apn;
905 ssize_t i;
906 struct timespec now;
907
908 i = 0;
909 timespecclear(&now);
910 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ap, addrs, next, apn) {
911 /* A delegated prefix is not an address. */
912 if (ap->flags & IPV6_AF_DELEGATEDPFX)
913 continue;
914 if (ap->prefix_vltime == 0) {
915 if (ap->flags & IPV6_AF_ADDED) {
916 ipv6_deleteaddr(ap);
917 i++;
918 }
919 eloop_q_timeout_delete(ap->iface->ctx->eloop,
920 0, NULL, ap);
921 if (ap->flags & IPV6_AF_REQUEST) {
922 ap->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_ADDED;
923 } else {
924 TAILQ_REMOVE(addrs, ap, next);
925 ipv6_freeaddr(ap);
926 }
927 } else if (!(ap->flags & IPV6_AF_STALE) &&
928 !IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&ap->addr))
929 {
930 if (ap->flags & IPV6_AF_NEW)
931 i++;
932 if (!timespecisset(&now))
933 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &now);
934 ipv6_addaddr(ap, &now);
935 }
936 }
937
938 return i;
939}
940
941void
942ipv6_freeaddr(struct ipv6_addr *ia)
943{
944#ifndef SMALL
945 struct ipv6_addr *iad;
946
947 /* Forget the reference */
948 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DELEGATEDPFX) {
949 TAILQ_FOREACH(iad, &ia->pd_pfxs, pd_next) {
950 iad->delegating_prefix = NULL;
951 }
952 } else if (ia->delegating_prefix != NULL) {
953 TAILQ_REMOVE(&ia->delegating_prefix->pd_pfxs, ia, pd_next);
954 }
955#endif
956
957 if (ia->dhcp6_fd != -1) {
958 close(ia->dhcp6_fd);
959 eloop_event_delete(ia->iface->ctx->eloop, ia->dhcp6_fd);
960 }
961
962 eloop_q_timeout_delete(ia->iface->ctx->eloop, 0, NULL, ia);
963 free(ia->na);
964 free(ia);
965}
966
967void
968ipv6_freedrop_addrs(struct ipv6_addrhead *addrs, int drop,
969 const struct interface *ifd)
970{
971 struct ipv6_addr *ap, *apn, *apf;
972 struct timespec now;
973
974#ifdef SMALL
975 UNUSED(ifd);
976#endif
977 timespecclear(&now);
978 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ap, addrs, next, apn) {
979#ifndef SMALL
980 if (ifd != NULL &&
981 (ap->delegating_prefix == NULL ||
982 ap->delegating_prefix->iface != ifd))
983 continue;
984#endif
985 if (drop != 2)
986 TAILQ_REMOVE(addrs, ap, next);
987 if (drop && ap->flags & IPV6_AF_ADDED &&
988 (ap->iface->options->options &
989 (DHCPCD_EXITING | DHCPCD_PERSISTENT)) !=
990 (DHCPCD_EXITING | DHCPCD_PERSISTENT))
991 {
992 /* Don't drop link-local addresses. */
993 if (!IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&ap->addr) ||
994 CAN_DROP_LLADDR(ap->iface))
995 {
996 if (drop == 2)
997 TAILQ_REMOVE(addrs, ap, next);
998 /* Find the same address somewhere else */
999 apf = ipv6_findaddr(ap->iface->ctx, &ap->addr,
1000 0);
1001 if ((apf == NULL ||
1002 (apf->iface != ap->iface)))
1003 ipv6_deleteaddr(ap);
1004 if (!(ap->iface->options->options &
1005 DHCPCD_EXITING) && apf)
1006 {
1007 if (!timespecisset(&now))
1008 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC,
1009 &now);
1010 ipv6_addaddr(apf, &now);
1011 }
1012 if (drop == 2)
1013 ipv6_freeaddr(ap);
1014 }
1015 }
1016 if (drop != 2)
1017 ipv6_freeaddr(ap);
1018 }
1019}
1020
1021static struct ipv6_state *
1022ipv6_getstate(struct interface *ifp)
1023{
1024 struct ipv6_state *state;
1025
1026 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1027 if (state == NULL) {
1028 ifp->if_data[IF_DATA_IPV6] = calloc(1, sizeof(*state));
1029 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1030 if (state == NULL) {
1031 logerr(__func__);
1032 return NULL;
1033 }
1034 TAILQ_INIT(&state->addrs);
1035 TAILQ_INIT(&state->ll_callbacks);
1036
1037 /* Regenerate new ids */
1038 if (ifp->options &&
1039 ip6_use_tempaddr(ifp->name))
1040 ipv6_regentempifid(ifp);
1041 }
1042 return state;
1043}
1044
1045void
1046ipv6_handleifa(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx,
1047 int cmd, struct if_head *ifs, const char *ifname,
1048 const struct in6_addr *addr, uint8_t prefix_len, int addrflags, pid_t pid)
1049{
1050 struct interface *ifp;
1051 struct ipv6_state *state;
1052 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1053 struct ll_callback *cb;
1054
1055#if 0
1056 char dbuf[INET6_ADDRSTRLEN];
1057 const char *dbp;
1058
1059 dbp = inet_ntop(AF_INET6, &addr->s6_addr,
1060 dbuf, INET6_ADDRSTRLEN);
1061 loginfox("%s: cmd %d addr %s",
1062 ifname, cmd, dbp);
1063#endif
1064
1065 if (ifs == NULL)
1066 ifs = ctx->ifaces;
1067 if (ifs == NULL)
1068 return;
1069 if ((ifp = if_find(ifs, ifname)) == NULL)
1070 return;
1071 if ((state = ipv6_getstate(ifp)) == NULL)
1072 return;
1073
1074 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
1075 if (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ia->addr, addr))
1076 break;
1077 }
1078
1079 switch (cmd) {
1080 case RTM_DELADDR:
1081 if (ia != NULL) {
1082 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->addrs, ia, next);
1083 /* Advertise the address if it exists on
1084 * another interface. */
1085 ipv6nd_advertise(ia);
1086 /* We'll free it at the end of the function. */
1087 }
1088 break;
1089 case RTM_NEWADDR:
1090 if (ia == NULL) {
1091 ia = ipv6_newaddr(ifp, addr, prefix_len, 0);
1092#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
1093 strlcpy(ia->alias, ifname, sizeof(ia->alias));
1094#endif
1095 if (if_getlifetime6(ia) == -1) {
1096 /* No support or address vanished.
1097 * Either way, just set a deprecated
1098 * infinite time lifetime and continue.
1099 * This is fine because we only want
1100 * to know this when trying to extend
1101 * temporary addresses.
1102 * As we can't extend infinite, we'll
1103 * create a new temporary address. */
1104 ia->prefix_pltime = 0;
1105 ia->prefix_vltime =
1106 ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME;
1107 }
1108 /* This is a minor regression against RFC 4941
1109 * because the kernel only knows when the
1110 * lifetimes were last updated, not when the
1111 * address was initially created.
1112 * Provided dhcpcd is not restarted, this
1113 * won't be a problem.
1114 * If we don't like it, we can always
1115 * pretend lifetimes are infinite and always
1116 * generate a new temporary address on
1117 * restart. */
1118 ia->acquired = ia->created;
1119 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ia, next);
1120 }
1121 ia->addr_flags = addrflags;
1122 ia->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_STALE;
1123#ifdef IPV6_MANAGETEMPADDR
1124 if (ia->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_TEMPORARY)
1125 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY;
1126#endif
1127 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&ia->addr) || ia->dadcallback) {
1128#ifdef IPV6_POLLADDRFLAG
1129 if (ia->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_TENTATIVE) {
1130 struct timespec tv;
1131
1132 ms_to_ts(&tv, RETRANS_TIMER / 2);
1133 eloop_timeout_add_tv(
1134 ia->iface->ctx->eloop,
1135 &tv, ipv6_checkaddrflags, ia);
1136 break;
1137 }
1138#endif
1139
1140 if (ia->dadcallback) {
1141 ia->dadcallback(ia);
1142 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_FORKED)
1143 goto out;
1144 }
1145
1146 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&ia->addr) &&
1147 !(ia->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_NOTUSEABLE))
1148 {
1149 /* Now run any callbacks.
1150 * Typically IPv6RS or DHCPv6 */
1151 while ((cb =
1152 TAILQ_FIRST(&state->ll_callbacks)))
1153 {
1154 TAILQ_REMOVE(
1155 &state->ll_callbacks,
1156 cb, next);
1157 cb->callback(cb->arg);
1158 free(cb);
1159 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_FORKED)
1160 goto out;
1161 }
1162 }
1163 }
1164 break;
1165 }
1166
1167 if (ia == NULL)
1168 return;
1169
1170 ipv6nd_handleifa(cmd, ia, pid);
1171#ifdef DHCP6
1172 dhcp6_handleifa(cmd, ia, pid);
1173#endif
1174
1175out:
1176 /* Done with the ia now, so free it. */
1177 if (cmd == RTM_DELADDR)
1178 ipv6_freeaddr(ia);
1179}
1180
1181int
1182ipv6_hasaddr(const struct interface *ifp)
1183{
1184
1185 if (ipv6nd_iffindaddr(ifp, NULL, 0) != NULL)
1186 return 1;
1187#ifdef DHCP6
1188 if (dhcp6_iffindaddr(ifp, NULL, 0) != NULL)
1189 return 1;
1190#endif
1191 return 0;
1192}
1193
1194struct ipv6_addr *
1195ipv6_iffindaddr(struct interface *ifp, const struct in6_addr *addr,
1196 int revflags)
1197{
1198 struct ipv6_state *state;
1199 struct ipv6_addr *ap;
1200
1201 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1202 if (state) {
1203 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &state->addrs, next) {
1204 if (addr == NULL) {
1205 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&ap->addr) &&
1206 (!revflags || !(ap->addr_flags & revflags)))
1207 return ap;
1208 } else {
1209 if (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ap->addr, addr) &&
1210 (!revflags || !(ap->addr_flags & revflags)))
1211 return ap;
1212 }
1213 }
1214 }
1215 return NULL;
1216}
1217
1218static struct ipv6_addr *
1219ipv6_iffindmaskaddr(const struct interface *ifp, const struct in6_addr *addr)
1220{
1221 struct ipv6_state *state;
1222 struct ipv6_addr *ap;
1223 struct in6_addr mask;
1224
1225 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1226 if (state) {
1227 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &state->addrs, next) {
1228 if (ipv6_mask(&mask, ap->prefix_len) == -1)
1229 continue;
1230 if (IN6_ARE_MASKED_ADDR_EQUAL(&ap->addr, addr, &mask))
1231 return ap;
1232 }
1233 }
1234 return NULL;
1235}
1236
1237struct ipv6_addr *
1238ipv6_findmaskaddr(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, const struct in6_addr *addr)
1239{
1240 struct interface *ifp;
1241 struct ipv6_addr *ap;
1242
1243 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
1244 ap = ipv6_iffindmaskaddr(ifp, addr);
1245 if (ap != NULL)
1246 return ap;
1247 }
1248 return NULL;
1249}
1250
1251int
1252ipv6_addlinklocalcallback(struct interface *ifp,
1253 void (*callback)(void *), void *arg)
1254{
1255 struct ipv6_state *state;
1256 struct ll_callback *cb;
1257
1258 state = ipv6_getstate(ifp);
1259 TAILQ_FOREACH(cb, &state->ll_callbacks, next) {
1260 if (cb->callback == callback && cb->arg == arg)
1261 break;
1262 }
1263 if (cb == NULL) {
1264 cb = malloc(sizeof(*cb));
1265 if (cb == NULL) {
1266 logerr(__func__);
1267 return -1;
1268 }
1269 cb->callback = callback;
1270 cb->arg = arg;
1271 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->ll_callbacks, cb, next);
1272 }
1273 return 0;
1274}
1275
1276static struct ipv6_addr *
1277ipv6_newlinklocal(struct interface *ifp)
1278{
1279 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1280 struct in6_addr in6;
1281
1282 memset(&in6, 0, sizeof(in6));
1283 in6.s6_addr32[0] = htonl(0xfe800000);
1284 ia = ipv6_newaddr(ifp, &in6, 64, 0);
1285 if (ia != NULL) {
1286 ia->prefix_pltime = ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME;
1287 ia->prefix_vltime = ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME;
1288 }
1289 return ia;
1290}
1291
1292static const uint8_t allzero[8] = { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
1293static const uint8_t allone[8] =
1294 { 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff };
1295
1296static int
1297ipv6_addlinklocal(struct interface *ifp)
1298{
1299 struct ipv6_state *state;
1300 struct ipv6_addr *ap, *ap2;
1301 int dadcounter;
1302
1303 /* Check sanity before malloc */
1304 if (!(ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_SLAACPRIVATE)) {
1305 switch (ifp->family) {
1306 case ARPHRD_ETHER:
1307 /* Check for a valid hardware address */
1308 if (ifp->hwlen != 6 && ifp->hwlen != 8) {
1309 errno = ENOTSUP;
1310 return -1;
1311 }
1312 if (memcmp(ifp->hwaddr, allzero, ifp->hwlen) == 0 ||
1313 memcmp(ifp->hwaddr, allone, ifp->hwlen) == 0)
1314 {
1315 errno = EINVAL;
1316 return -1;
1317 }
1318 break;
1319 default:
1320 errno = ENOTSUP;
1321 return -1;
1322 }
1323 }
1324
1325 state = ipv6_getstate(ifp);
1326 if (state == NULL)
1327 return -1;
1328
1329 ap = ipv6_newlinklocal(ifp);
1330 if (ap == NULL)
1331 return -1;
1332
1333 dadcounter = 0;
1334 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_SLAACPRIVATE) {
1335nextslaacprivate:
1336 if (ipv6_makestableprivate(&ap->addr,
1337 &ap->prefix, ap->prefix_len, ifp, &dadcounter) == -1)
1338 {
1339 free(ap);
1340 return -1;
1341 }
1342 ap->dadcounter = dadcounter;
1343 } else {
1344 memcpy(ap->addr.s6_addr, ap->prefix.s6_addr, 8);
1345 switch (ifp->family) {
1346 case ARPHRD_ETHER:
1347 if (ifp->hwlen == 6) {
1348 ap->addr.s6_addr[ 8] = ifp->hwaddr[0];
1349 ap->addr.s6_addr[ 9] = ifp->hwaddr[1];
1350 ap->addr.s6_addr[10] = ifp->hwaddr[2];
1351 ap->addr.s6_addr[11] = 0xff;
1352 ap->addr.s6_addr[12] = 0xfe;
1353 ap->addr.s6_addr[13] = ifp->hwaddr[3];
1354 ap->addr.s6_addr[14] = ifp->hwaddr[4];
1355 ap->addr.s6_addr[15] = ifp->hwaddr[5];
1356 } else if (ifp->hwlen == 8)
1357 memcpy(&ap->addr.s6_addr[8], ifp->hwaddr, 8);
1358 else {
1359 free(ap);
1360 errno = ENOTSUP;
1361 return -1;
1362 }
1363 break;
1364 }
1365
1366 /* Sanity check: g bit must not indciate "group" */
1367 if (EUI64_GROUP(&ap->addr)) {
1368 free(ap);
1369 errno = EINVAL;
1370 return -1;
1371 }
1372 EUI64_TO_IFID(&ap->addr);
1373 }
1374
1375 /* Do we already have this address? */
1376 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap2, &state->addrs, next) {
1377 if (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ap->addr, &ap2->addr)) {
1378 if (ap2->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_DUPLICATED) {
1379 if (ifp->options->options &
1380 DHCPCD_SLAACPRIVATE)
1381 {
1382 dadcounter++;
1383 goto nextslaacprivate;
1384 }
1385 free(ap);
1386 errno = EADDRNOTAVAIL;
1387 return -1;
1388 }
1389
1390 logwarnx("%s: waiting for %s to complete",
1391 ap2->iface->name, ap2->saddr);
1392 free(ap);
1393 errno = EEXIST;
1394 return 0;
1395 }
1396 }
1397
1398 inet_ntop(AF_INET6, &ap->addr, ap->saddr, sizeof(ap->saddr));
1399 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ap, next);
1400 ipv6_addaddr(ap, NULL);
1401 return 1;
1402}
1403
1404static int
1405ipv6_tryaddlinklocal(struct interface *ifp)
1406{
1407 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1408
1409 /* We can't assign a link-locak address to this,
1410 * the ppp process has to. */
1411 if (ifp->flags & IFF_POINTOPOINT)
1412 return 0;
1413
1414 ia = ipv6_iffindaddr(ifp, NULL, IN6_IFF_DUPLICATED);
1415 if (ia != NULL) {
1416#ifdef IPV6_POLLADDRFLAG
1417 if (ia->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_TENTATIVE) {
1418 struct timespec tv;
1419
1420 ms_to_ts(&tv, RETRANS_TIMER / 2);
1421 eloop_timeout_add_tv(
1422 ia->iface->ctx->eloop,
1423 &tv, ipv6_checkaddrflags, ia);
1424 }
1425#endif
1426 return 0;
1427 }
1428 if (!CAN_ADD_LLADDR(ifp))
1429 return 0;
1430
1431 return ipv6_addlinklocal(ifp);
1432}
1433
1434struct ipv6_addr *
1435ipv6_newaddr(struct interface *ifp, const struct in6_addr *addr,
1436 uint8_t prefix_len, unsigned int flags)
1437{
1438 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1439 char buf[INET6_ADDRSTRLEN];
1440 const char *cbp;
1441 bool tempaddr;
1442 int addr_flags;
1443
1444 /* If adding a new DHCP / RA derived address, check current flags
1445 * from an existing address. */
1446 ia = ipv6_iffindaddr(ifp, addr, 0);
1447 if (ia != NULL)
1448 addr_flags = ia->addr_flags;
1449 else
1450 addr_flags = IN6_IFF_TENTATIVE;
1451
1452 ia = calloc(1, sizeof(*ia));
1453 if (ia == NULL)
1454 goto err;
1455
1456 ia->iface = ifp;
1457 ia->flags = IPV6_AF_NEW | flags;
1458 ia->addr_flags = addr_flags;
1459 ia->prefix_len = prefix_len;
1460 ia->dhcp6_fd = -1;
1461
1462#ifdef IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY
1463 tempaddr = ia->flags & IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY;
1464#else
1465 tempaddr = false;
1466#endif
1467
1468 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_AUTOCONF && !tempaddr) {
1469 ia->prefix = *addr;
1470 ia->dadcounter = ipv6_makeaddr(&ia->addr, ifp,
1471 &ia->prefix,
1472 ia->prefix_len);
1473 if (ia->dadcounter == -1)
1474 goto err;
1475 } else if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_RAPFX) {
1476 ia->prefix = *addr;
1477 return ia;
1478 } else if (ia->flags & (IPV6_AF_REQUEST | IPV6_AF_DELEGATEDPFX) &&
1479 prefix_len != 128)
1480 {
1481 ia->prefix = *addr;
1482 cbp = inet_ntop(AF_INET6, &ia->prefix, buf, sizeof(buf));
1483 goto paddr;
1484 } else {
1485 ia->addr = *addr;
1486 if (ipv6_makeprefix(&ia->prefix,
1487 &ia->addr, ia->prefix_len) == -1)
1488 goto err;
1489 }
1490
1491 cbp = inet_ntop(AF_INET6, &ia->addr, buf, sizeof(buf));
1492paddr:
1493 if (cbp == NULL)
1494 goto err;
1495 snprintf(ia->saddr, sizeof(ia->saddr), "%s/%d", cbp, ia->prefix_len);
1496
1497 return ia;
1498
1499err:
1500 logerr(__func__);
1501 free(ia);
1502 return NULL;
1503}
1504
1505static void
1506ipv6_staticdadcallback(void *arg)
1507{
1508 struct ipv6_addr *ia = arg;
1509 int wascompleted;
1510
1511 wascompleted = (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED);
1512 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED;
1513 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DUPLICATED)
1514 logwarnx("%s: DAD detected %s", ia->iface->name,
1515 ia->saddr);
1516 else if (!wascompleted) {
1517 logdebugx("%s: IPv6 static DAD completed",
1518 ia->iface->name);
1519 }
1520
1521#define FINISHED (IPV6_AF_ADDED | IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED)
1522 if (!wascompleted) {
1523 struct interface *ifp;
1524 struct ipv6_state *state;
1525
1526 ifp = ia->iface;
1527 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1528 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
1529 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_STATIC &&
1530 (ia->flags & FINISHED) != FINISHED)
1531 {
1532 wascompleted = 1;
1533 break;
1534 }
1535 }
1536 if (!wascompleted)
1537 script_runreason(ifp, "STATIC6");
1538 }
1539#undef FINISHED
1540}
1541
1542ssize_t
1543ipv6_env(char **env, const char *prefix, const struct interface *ifp)
1544{
1545 char **ep;
1546 ssize_t n;
1547 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1548
1549 ep = env;
1550 n = 0;
1551 ia = ipv6_iffindaddr(UNCONST(ifp), &ifp->options->req_addr6,
1552 IN6_IFF_NOTUSEABLE);
1553 if (ia) {
1554 if (env)
1555 addvar(&ep, prefix, "ip6_address", ia->saddr);
1556 n++;
1557 }
1558
1559 return n;
1560}
1561
1562int
1563ipv6_staticdadcompleted(const struct interface *ifp)
1564{
1565 const struct ipv6_state *state;
1566 const struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1567 int n;
1568
1569 if ((state = IPV6_CSTATE(ifp)) == NULL)
1570 return 0;
1571 n = 0;
1572#define COMPLETED (IPV6_AF_STATIC | IPV6_AF_ADDED | IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED)
1573 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
1574 if ((ia->flags & COMPLETED) == COMPLETED &&
1575 !(ia->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_NOTUSEABLE))
1576 n++;
1577 }
1578 return n;
1579}
1580
1581int
1582ipv6_startstatic(struct interface *ifp)
1583{
1584 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1585 int run_script;
1586
1587 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&ifp->options->req_addr6))
1588 return 0;
1589
1590 ia = ipv6_iffindaddr(ifp, &ifp->options->req_addr6, 0);
1591 if (ia != NULL &&
1592 (ia->prefix_len != ifp->options->req_prefix_len ||
1593 ia->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_NOTUSEABLE))
1594 {
1595 ipv6_deleteaddr(ia);
1596 ia = NULL;
1597 }
1598 if (ia == NULL) {
1599 struct ipv6_state *state;
1600
1601 ia = ipv6_newaddr(ifp, &ifp->options->req_addr6,
1602 ifp->options->req_prefix_len, 0);
1603 if (ia == NULL)
1604 return -1;
1605 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1606 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ia, next);
1607 run_script = 0;
1608 } else
1609 run_script = 1;
1610 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_STATIC | IPV6_AF_ONLINK;
1611 ia->prefix_vltime = ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME;
1612 ia->prefix_pltime = ND6_INFINITE_LIFETIME;
1613 ia->dadcallback = ipv6_staticdadcallback;
1614 ipv6_addaddr(ia, NULL);
1615 if_initrt(ifp->ctx, AF_INET6);
1616 rt_build(ifp->ctx, AF_INET6);
1617 if (run_script)
1618 script_runreason(ifp, "STATIC6");
1619 return 1;
1620}
1621
1622/* Ensure the interface has a link-local address */
1623int
1624ipv6_start(struct interface *ifp)
1625{
1626#ifdef IPV6_POLLADDRFLAG
1627 struct ipv6_state *state;
1628
1629 /* We need to update the address flags. */
1630 if ((state = IPV6_STATE(ifp)) != NULL) {
1631 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1632 const char *alias;
1633 int flags;
1634
1635 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
1636#ifdef ALIAS_ADDR
1637 alias = ia->alias;
1638#else
1639 alias = NULL;
1640#endif
1641 flags = if_addrflags6(ia->iface, &ia->addr, alias);
1642 if (flags != -1)
1643 ia->addr_flags = flags;
1644 }
1645 }
1646#endif
1647
1648 if (ipv6_tryaddlinklocal(ifp) == -1)
1649 return -1;
1650
1651 if (IPV6_CSTATE(ifp)) {
1652 /* Regenerate new ids */
1653 if (ip6_use_tempaddr(ifp->name))
1654 ipv6_regentempifid(ifp);
1655 }
1656
1657 /* Load existing routes */
1658 if_initrt(ifp->ctx, AF_INET6);
1659 return 0;
1660}
1661
1662void
1663ipv6_freedrop(struct interface *ifp, int drop)
1664{
1665 struct ipv6_state *state;
1666 struct ll_callback *cb;
1667
1668 if (ifp == NULL)
1669 return;
1670
1671 if ((state = IPV6_STATE(ifp)) == NULL)
1672 return;
1673
1674 /* If we got here, we can get rid of any LL callbacks. */
1675 while ((cb = TAILQ_FIRST(&state->ll_callbacks))) {
1676 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->ll_callbacks, cb, next);
1677 free(cb);
1678 }
1679
1680 ipv6_freedrop_addrs(&state->addrs, drop ? 2 : 0, NULL);
1681 if (drop) {
1682 if (ifp->ctx->ra_routers != NULL) {
1683 if_initrt(ifp->ctx, AF_INET6);
1684 rt_build(ifp->ctx, AF_INET6);
1685 }
1686 } else {
1687 /* Because we need to cache the addresses we don't control,
1688 * we only free the state on when NOT dropping addresses. */
1689 free(state);
1690 ifp->if_data[IF_DATA_IPV6] = NULL;
1691 eloop_timeout_delete(ifp->ctx->eloop, NULL, ifp);
1692 }
1693}
1694
1695void
1696ipv6_ctxfree(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
1697{
1698
1699 free(ctx->ra_routers);
1700 free(ctx->secret);
1701}
1702
1703int
1704ipv6_handleifa_addrs(int cmd,
1705 struct ipv6_addrhead *addrs, const struct ipv6_addr *addr, pid_t pid)
1706{
1707 struct ipv6_addr *ia, *ian;
1708 uint8_t found, alldadcompleted;
1709
1710 alldadcompleted = 1;
1711 found = 0;
1712 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ia, addrs, next, ian) {
1713 if (!IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&addr->addr, &ia->addr)) {
1714 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_ADDED &&
1715 !(ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED))
1716 alldadcompleted = 0;
1717 continue;
1718 }
1719 switch (cmd) {
1720 case RTM_DELADDR:
1721 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_ADDED) {
1722 logwarnx("%s: pid %d deleted address %s",
1723 ia->iface->name, pid, ia->saddr);
1724 ia->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_ADDED;
1725 }
1726 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DELEGATED) {
1727 TAILQ_REMOVE(addrs, ia, next);
1728 ipv6_deletedaddr(ia);
1729 ipv6_freeaddr(ia);
1730 }
1731 break;
1732 case RTM_NEWADDR:
1733 /* Safety - ignore tentative announcements */
1734 if (addr->addr_flags &
1735 (IN6_IFF_DETACHED | IN6_IFF_TENTATIVE))
1736 break;
1737 if ((ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED) == 0) {
1738 found++;
1739 if (addr->addr_flags & IN6_IFF_DUPLICATED)
1740 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_DUPLICATED;
1741 else
1742 ia->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_DUPLICATED;
1743 if (ia->dadcallback)
1744 ia->dadcallback(ia);
1745 /* We need to set this here in-case the
1746 * dadcallback function checks it */
1747 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_DADCOMPLETED;
1748 }
1749 break;
1750 }
1751 }
1752
1753 return alldadcompleted ? found : 0;
1754}
1755
1756#ifdef IPV6_MANAGETEMPADDR
1757static const struct ipv6_addr *
1758ipv6_findaddrid(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, uint8_t *addr)
1759{
1760 const struct interface *ifp;
1761 const struct ipv6_state *state;
1762 const struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1763
1764 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
1765 if ((state = IPV6_CSTATE(ifp))) {
1766 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
1767 if (memcmp(&ia->addr.s6_addr[8], addr, 8) == 0)
1768 return ia;
1769 }
1770 }
1771 }
1772 return NULL;
1773}
1774
1775static const uint8_t nullid[8];
1776static const uint8_t anycastid[8] = {
1777 0xfd, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0x80 };
1778static const uint8_t isatapid[4] = { 0x00, 0x00, 0x5e, 0xfe };
1779
1780static void
1781ipv6_regen_desync(struct interface *ifp, int force)
1782{
1783 struct ipv6_state *state;
1784 time_t max;
1785
1786 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
1787
1788 /* RFC4941 Section 5 states that DESYNC_FACTOR must never be
1789 * greater than TEMP_VALID_LIFETIME - REGEN_ADVANCE.
1790 * I believe this is an error and it should be never be greateter than
1791 * TEMP_PREFERRED_LIFETIME - REGEN_ADVANCE. */
1792 max = ip6_temp_preferred_lifetime(ifp->name) - REGEN_ADVANCE;
1793 if (state->desync_factor && !force && state->desync_factor < max)
1794 return;
1795 if (state->desync_factor == 0)
1796 state->desync_factor =
1797 (time_t)arc4random_uniform(MIN(MAX_DESYNC_FACTOR,
1798 (uint32_t)max));
1799 max = ip6_temp_preferred_lifetime(ifp->name) -
1800 state->desync_factor - REGEN_ADVANCE;
1801 eloop_timeout_add_sec(ifp->ctx->eloop, max, ipv6_regentempifid, ifp);
1802}
1803
1804void
1805ipv6_gentempifid(struct interface *ifp)
1806{
1807 struct ipv6_state *state;
1808 MD5_CTX md5;
1809 uint8_t seed[16], digest[16];
1810 int retry;
1811
1812 if ((state = IPV6_STATE(ifp)) == NULL)
1813 return;
1814
1815 retry = 0;
1816 if (memcmp(nullid, state->randomseed0, sizeof(nullid)) == 0) {
1817 uint32_t r;
1818
1819 r = arc4random();
1820 memcpy(seed, &r, sizeof(r));
1821 r = arc4random();
1822 memcpy(seed + sizeof(r), &r, sizeof(r));
1823 } else
1824 memcpy(seed, state->randomseed0, sizeof(state->randomseed0));
1825
1826 memcpy(seed + sizeof(state->randomseed0),
1827 state->randomseed1, sizeof(state->randomseed1));
1828
1829again:
1830 MD5Init(&md5);
1831 MD5Update(&md5, seed, sizeof(seed));
1832 MD5Final(digest, &md5);
1833
1834 /* RFC4941 Section 3.2.1.1
1835 * Take the left-most 64bits and set bit 6 to zero */
1836 memcpy(state->randomid, digest, sizeof(state->randomid));
1837 state->randomid[0] = (uint8_t)(state->randomid[0] & ~EUI64_UBIT);
1838
1839 /* RFC4941 Section 3.2.1.4
1840 * Reject reserved or existing id's */
1841 if (memcmp(nullid, state->randomid, sizeof(nullid)) == 0 ||
1842 (memcmp(anycastid, state->randomid, 7) == 0 &&
1843 (anycastid[7] & state->randomid[7]) == anycastid[7]) ||
1844 memcmp(isatapid, state->randomid, sizeof(isatapid)) == 0 ||
1845 ipv6_findaddrid(ifp->ctx, state->randomid))
1846 {
1847 if (++retry < GEN_TEMPID_RETRY_MAX) {
1848 memcpy(seed, digest + 8, 8);
1849 goto again;
1850 }
1851 memset(state->randomid, 0, sizeof(state->randomid));
1852 }
1853
1854 /* RFC4941 Section 3.2.1.6
1855 * Save the right-most 64bits of the digest */
1856 memcpy(state->randomseed0, digest + 8,
1857 sizeof(state->randomseed0));
1858}
1859
1860/* RFC4941 Section 3.3.7 */
1861static void
1862ipv6_tempdadcallback(void *arg)
1863{
1864 struct ipv6_addr *ia = arg;
1865
1866 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_DUPLICATED) {
1867 struct ipv6_addr *ia1;
1868 struct timespec tv;
1869
1870 if (++ia->dadcounter == TEMP_IDGEN_RETRIES) {
1871 logerrx("%s: too many duplicate temporary addresses",
1872 ia->iface->name);
1873 return;
1874 }
1875 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &tv);
1876 if ((ia1 = ipv6_createtempaddr(ia, &tv)) == NULL)
1877 logerr(__func__);
1878 else
1879 ia1->dadcounter = ia->dadcounter;
1880 ipv6_deleteaddr(ia);
1881 if (ia1)
1882 ipv6_addaddr(ia1, &ia1->acquired);
1883 }
1884}
1885
1886struct ipv6_addr *
1887ipv6_createtempaddr(struct ipv6_addr *ia0, const struct timespec *now)
1888{
1889 struct ipv6_state *state;
1890 const struct ipv6_state *cstate;
1891 int genid;
1892 struct in6_addr addr, mask;
1893 uint32_t randid[2];
1894 const struct interface *ifp;
1895 const struct ipv6_addr *ap;
1896 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
1897 uint32_t i, trylimit;
1898
1899 trylimit = TEMP_IDGEN_RETRIES;
1900 state = IPV6_STATE(ia0->iface);
1901 genid = 0;
1902
1903 addr = ia0->addr;
1904 ipv6_mask(&mask, ia0->prefix_len);
1905 /* clear the old ifid */
1906 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
1907 addr.s6_addr32[i] &= mask.s6_addr32[i];
1908
1909again:
1910 if (memcmp(state->randomid, nullid, sizeof(nullid)) == 0)
1911 genid = 1;
1912 if (genid) {
1913 memcpy(state->randomseed1, &ia0->addr.s6_addr[8],
1914 sizeof(state->randomseed1));
1915 ipv6_gentempifid(ia0->iface);
1916 if (memcmp(state->randomid, nullid, sizeof(nullid)) == 0) {
1917 errno = EFAULT;
1918 return NULL;
1919 }
1920 }
1921 memcpy(&randid[0], state->randomid, sizeof(randid[0]));
1922 memcpy(&randid[1], state->randomid + sizeof(randid[1]),
1923 sizeof(randid[2]));
1924 addr.s6_addr32[2] |= randid[0] & ~mask.s6_addr32[2];
1925 addr.s6_addr32[3] |= randid[1] & ~mask.s6_addr32[3];
1926
1927 /* Ensure we don't already have it */
1928 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ia0->iface->ctx->ifaces, next) {
1929 cstate = IPV6_CSTATE(ifp);
1930 if (cstate) {
1931 TAILQ_FOREACH(ap, &cstate->addrs, next) {
1932 if (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ap->addr, &addr)) {
1933 if (--trylimit == 0) {
1934 errno = EEXIST;
1935 return NULL;
1936 }
1937 genid = 1;
1938 goto again;
1939 }
1940 }
1941 }
1942 }
1943
1944 ia = ipv6_newaddr(ia0->iface, &addr, ia0->prefix_len,
1945 IPV6_AF_AUTOCONF | IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY);
1946 /* Must be made tentative, for our DaD to work */
1947 ia->addr_flags = IN6_IFF_TENTATIVE;
1948 ia->dadcallback = ipv6_tempdadcallback;
1949 ia->created = ia->acquired = now ? *now : ia0->acquired;
1950
1951 /* Ensure desync is still valid */
1952 ipv6_regen_desync(ia->iface, 0);
1953
1954 /* RFC4941 Section 3.3.4 */
1955 i = (uint32_t)(ip6_temp_preferred_lifetime(ia0->iface->name) -
1956 state->desync_factor);
1957 ia->prefix_pltime = MIN(ia0->prefix_pltime, i);
1958 i = (uint32_t)ip6_temp_valid_lifetime(ia0->iface->name);
1959 ia->prefix_vltime = MIN(ia0->prefix_vltime, i);
1960 if (ia->prefix_pltime <= REGEN_ADVANCE ||
1961 ia->prefix_pltime > ia0->prefix_vltime)
1962 {
1963 errno = EINVAL;
1964 free(ia);
1965 return NULL;
1966 }
1967
1968 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->addrs, ia, next);
1969 return ia;
1970}
1971
1972struct ipv6_addr *
1973ipv6_settemptime(struct ipv6_addr *ia, int flags)
1974{
1975 struct ipv6_state *state;
1976 struct ipv6_addr *ap, *first;
1977
1978 state = IPV6_STATE(ia->iface);
1979 first = NULL;
1980 TAILQ_FOREACH_REVERSE(ap, &state->addrs, ipv6_addrhead, next) {
1981 if (ap->flags & IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY &&
1982 ap->prefix_pltime &&
1983 IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&ia->prefix, &ap->prefix))
1984 {
1985 time_t max, ext;
1986
1987 if (flags == 0) {
1988 if (ap->prefix_pltime -
1989 (uint32_t)(ia->acquired.tv_sec -
1990 ap->acquired.tv_sec)
1991 < REGEN_ADVANCE)
1992 continue;
1993
1994 return ap;
1995 }
1996
1997 if (!(ap->flags & IPV6_AF_ADDED))
1998 ap->flags |= IPV6_AF_NEW | IPV6_AF_AUTOCONF;
1999 ap->flags &= ~IPV6_AF_STALE;
2000
2001 /* RFC4941 Section 3.4
2002 * Deprecated prefix, deprecate the temporary address */
2003 if (ia->prefix_pltime == 0) {
2004 ap->prefix_pltime = 0;
2005 goto valid;
2006 }
2007
2008 /* Ensure desync is still valid */
2009 ipv6_regen_desync(ap->iface, 0);
2010
2011 /* RFC4941 Section 3.3.2
2012 * Extend temporary times, but ensure that they
2013 * never last beyond the system limit. */
2014 ext = ia->acquired.tv_sec + (time_t)ia->prefix_pltime;
2015 max = ap->created.tv_sec +
2016 ip6_temp_preferred_lifetime(ap->iface->name) -
2017 state->desync_factor;
2018 if (ext < max)
2019 ap->prefix_pltime = ia->prefix_pltime;
2020 else
2021 ap->prefix_pltime =
2022 (uint32_t)(max - ia->acquired.tv_sec);
2023
2024valid:
2025 ext = ia->acquired.tv_sec + (time_t)ia->prefix_vltime;
2026 max = ap->created.tv_sec +
2027 ip6_temp_valid_lifetime(ap->iface->name);
2028 if (ext < max)
2029 ap->prefix_vltime = ia->prefix_vltime;
2030 else
2031 ap->prefix_vltime =
2032 (uint32_t)(max - ia->acquired.tv_sec);
2033
2034 /* Just extend the latest matching prefix */
2035 ap->acquired = ia->acquired;
2036
2037 /* If extending return the last match as
2038 * it's the most current.
2039 * If deprecating, deprecate any other addresses we
2040 * may have, although this should not be needed */
2041 if (ia->prefix_pltime)
2042 return ap;
2043 if (first == NULL)
2044 first = ap;
2045 }
2046 }
2047 return first;
2048}
2049
2050void
2051ipv6_addtempaddrs(struct interface *ifp, const struct timespec *now)
2052{
2053 struct ipv6_state *state;
2054 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
2055
2056 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
2057 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
2058 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_TEMPORARY &&
2059 !(ia->flags & IPV6_AF_STALE))
2060 ipv6_addaddr(ia, now);
2061 }
2062}
2063
2064static void
2065ipv6_regentempaddr(void *arg)
2066{
2067 struct ipv6_addr *ia = arg, *ia1;
2068 struct timespec tv;
2069
2070 logdebugx("%s: regen temp addr %s", ia->iface->name, ia->saddr);
2071 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &tv);
2072 ia1 = ipv6_createtempaddr(ia, &tv);
2073 if (ia1)
2074 ipv6_addaddr(ia1, &tv);
2075 else
2076 logerr(__func__);
2077}
2078
2079static void
2080ipv6_regentempifid(void *arg)
2081{
2082 struct interface *ifp = arg;
2083 struct ipv6_state *state;
2084
2085 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
2086 if (memcmp(state->randomid, nullid, sizeof(state->randomid)))
2087 ipv6_gentempifid(ifp);
2088
2089 ipv6_regen_desync(ifp, 1);
2090}
2091#endif /* IPV6_MANAGETEMPADDR */
2092
2093void
2094ipv6_markaddrsstale(struct interface *ifp, unsigned int flags)
2095{
2096 struct ipv6_state *state;
2097 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
2098
2099 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
2100 if (state == NULL)
2101 return;
2102
2103 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
2104 if (flags == 0 || ia->flags & flags)
2105 ia->flags |= IPV6_AF_STALE;
2106 }
2107}
2108
2109void
2110ipv6_deletestaleaddrs(struct interface *ifp)
2111{
2112 struct ipv6_state *state;
2113 struct ipv6_addr *ia, *ia1;
2114
2115 state = IPV6_STATE(ifp);
2116 if (state == NULL)
2117 return;
2118
2119 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ia, &state->addrs, next, ia1) {
2120 if (ia->flags & IPV6_AF_STALE)
2121 ipv6_handleifa(ifp->ctx, RTM_DELADDR,
2122 ifp->ctx->ifaces, ifp->name,
2123 &ia->addr, ia->prefix_len, 0, getpid());
2124 }
2125}
2126
2127
2128static struct rt *
2129inet6_makeroute(struct interface *ifp, const struct ra *rap)
2130{
2131 struct rt *rt;
2132
2133 if ((rt = rt_new(ifp)) == NULL)
2134 return NULL;
2135
2136#ifdef HAVE_ROUTE_METRIC
2137 rt->rt_metric = ifp->metric;
2138#endif
2139 if (rap != NULL)
2140 rt->rt_mtu = rap->mtu;
2141 return rt;
2142}
2143
2144static struct rt *
2145inet6_makeprefix(struct interface *ifp, const struct ra *rap,
2146 const struct ipv6_addr *addr)
2147{
2148 struct rt *rt;
2149 struct in6_addr netmask;
2150
2151 if (addr == NULL || addr->prefix_len > 128) {
2152 errno = EINVAL;
2153 return NULL;
2154 }
2155
2156 /* There is no point in trying to manage a /128 prefix,
2157 * ones without a lifetime. */
2158 if (addr->prefix_len == 128 || addr->prefix_vltime == 0)
2159 return NULL;
2160
2161 /* Don't install a reject route when not creating bigger prefixes. */
2162 if (addr->flags & IPV6_AF_NOREJECT)
2163 return NULL;
2164
2165 /* This address is the delegated prefix, so add a reject route for
2166 * it via the loopback interface. */
2167 if (addr->flags & IPV6_AF_DELEGATEDPFX) {
2168 struct interface *lo0;
2169
2170 TAILQ_FOREACH(lo0, ifp->ctx->ifaces, next) {
2171 if (lo0->flags & IFF_LOOPBACK)
2172 break;
2173 }
2174 if (lo0 == NULL)
2175 logwarnx("cannot find a loopback interface "
2176 "to reject via");
2177 else
2178 ifp = lo0;
2179 }
2180
2181 if ((rt = inet6_makeroute(ifp, rap)) == NULL)
2182 return NULL;
2183
2184 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_dest, &addr->prefix);
2185 ipv6_mask(&netmask, addr->prefix_len);
2186 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_netmask, &netmask);
2187 if (addr->flags & IPV6_AF_DELEGATEDPFX) {
2188 rt->rt_flags |= RTF_REJECT;
2189 /* Linux does not like a gateway for a reject route. */
2190#ifndef __linux__
2191 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_gateway, &in6addr_loopback);
2192#endif
2193 } else if (!(addr->flags & IPV6_AF_ONLINK))
2194 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_gateway, &rap->from);
2195 else
2196 rt->rt_gateway.sa_family = AF_UNSPEC;
2197 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_ifa, &addr->addr);
2198 return rt;
2199}
2200
2201static struct rt *
2202inet6_makerouter(struct ra *rap)
2203{
2204 struct rt *rt;
2205
2206 if ((rt = inet6_makeroute(rap->iface, rap)) == NULL)
2207 return NULL;
2208 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_dest, &in6addr_any);
2209 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_netmask, &in6addr_any);
2210 sa_in6_init(&rt->rt_gateway, &rap->from);
2211 return rt;
2212}
2213
2214#define RT_IS_DEFAULT(rtp) \
2215 (IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&((rtp)->dest), &in6addr_any) && \
2216 IN6_ARE_ADDR_EQUAL(&((rtp)->mask), &in6addr_any))
2217
2218static int
2219inet6_staticroutes(struct rt_head *routes, struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
2220{
2221 struct interface *ifp;
2222 struct ipv6_state *state;
2223 struct ipv6_addr *ia;
2224 struct rt *rt;
2225
2226 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
2227 if ((state = IPV6_STATE(ifp)) == NULL)
2228 continue;
2229 TAILQ_FOREACH(ia, &state->addrs, next) {
2230 if ((ia->flags & (IPV6_AF_ADDED | IPV6_AF_STATIC)) ==
2231 (IPV6_AF_ADDED | IPV6_AF_STATIC))
2232 {
2233 rt = inet6_makeprefix(ifp, NULL, ia);
2234 if (rt)
2235 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(routes, rt, rt_next);
2236 }
2237 }
2238 }
2239 return 0;
2240}
2241
2242static int
2243inet6_raroutes(struct rt_head *routes, struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, int expired,
2244 bool *have_default)
2245{
2246 struct rt *rt;
2247 struct ra *rap;
2248 const struct ipv6_addr *addr;
2249
2250 TAILQ_FOREACH(rap, ctx->ra_routers, next) {
2251 if (rap->expired != expired)
2252 continue;
2253 TAILQ_FOREACH(addr, &rap->addrs, next) {
2254 if (addr->prefix_vltime == 0)
2255 continue;
2256 rt = inet6_makeprefix(rap->iface, rap, addr);
2257 if (rt) {
2258 rt->rt_dflags |= RTDF_RA;
2259 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(routes, rt, rt_next);
2260 }
2261 }
2262 if (rap->lifetime) {
2263 rt = inet6_makerouter(rap);
2264 if (rt) {
2265 rt->rt_dflags |= RTDF_RA;
2266 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(routes, rt, rt_next);
2267 if (have_default)
2268 *have_default = true;
2269 }
2270 }
2271 }
2272 return 0;
2273}
2274
2275#ifdef DHCP6
2276static int
2277inet6_dhcproutes(struct rt_head *routes, struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx,
2278 enum DH6S dstate)
2279{
2280 struct interface *ifp;
2281 const struct dhcp6_state *d6_state;
2282 const struct ipv6_addr *addr;
2283 struct rt *rt;
2284
2285 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
2286 d6_state = D6_CSTATE(ifp);
2287 if (d6_state && d6_state->state == dstate) {
2288 TAILQ_FOREACH(addr, &d6_state->addrs, next) {
2289 rt = inet6_makeprefix(ifp, NULL, addr);
2290 if (rt) {
2291 rt->rt_dflags |= RTDF_DHCP;
2292 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(routes, rt, rt_next);
2293 }
2294 }
2295 }
2296 }
2297 return 0;
2298}
2299#endif
2300
2301bool
2302inet6_getroutes(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, struct rt_head *routes)
2303{
2304 bool have_default;
2305
2306 /* Should static take priority? */
2307 if (inet6_staticroutes(routes, ctx) == -1)
2308 return false;
2309
2310 /* First add reachable routers and their prefixes */
2311 have_default = false;
2312 if (inet6_raroutes(routes, ctx, 0, &have_default) == -1)
2313 return false;
2314
2315#ifdef DHCP6
2316 /* We have no way of knowing if prefixes added by DHCP are reachable
2317 * or not, so we have to assume they are.
2318 * Add bound before delegated so we can prefer interfaces better */
2319 if (inet6_dhcproutes(routes, ctx, DH6S_BOUND) == -1)
2320 return false;
2321 if (inet6_dhcproutes(routes, ctx, DH6S_DELEGATED) == -1)
2322 return false;
2323#endif
2324
2325#ifdef HAVE_ROUTE_METRIC
2326 /* If we have an unreachable router, we really do need to remove the
2327 * route to it beause it could be a lower metric than a reachable
2328 * router. Of course, we should at least have some routers if all
2329 * are unreachable. */
2330 if (!have_default) {
2331#endif
2332 /* Add our non-reachable routers and prefixes
2333 * Unsure if this is needed, but it's a close match to kernel
2334 * behaviour */
2335 if (inet6_raroutes(routes, ctx, 1, NULL) == -1)
2336 return false;
2337#ifdef HAVE_ROUTE_METRIC
2338 }
2339#endif
2340
2341 return true;
2342}
